executeMessage(uint64,uint64,uint32,addr.notice: Execute the message (invoke external call according to the message content) if the message has reached the power threshold (the same message has been delivered by enough multiple bridges). Param values can be found in the MultiMessageMsgSent event from the source chain MultiMessageSender contract.

getMessageInfo(bytes32).notice: View message info, return (executed, msgPower, delivered adapters)

initialize(uint256,address,address[],uin.notice: A one-time function to initialize contract states.

isTrustedExecutor(address).notice: Check which executor this contract trust.

receiveMessage((uint64,uint32,address,by.notice: Receive messages from allowed bridge receiver adapters. If the accumulated power of a message has reached the power threshold, this message will be executed immediately, which will invoke an external function call according to the message content.

trustedExecutor(uint256).notice: Address of the trusted executor contract.

updateMultiMessageSender(uint256,address.notice: Update MultiMessageSender on source chain. This function can only be called by executeMessage() invoked within receiveMessage() of this contract, which means the only party who can make these updates is the caller of the MultiMessageSender at the source chain.

updateQuorumThreshold(uint64).notice: Update power quorum threshold of message execution. This function can only be called by executeMessage() invoked within receiveMessage() of this contract, which means the only party who can make these updates is the caller of the MultiMessageSender at the source chain.

updateReceiverAdapter(address[],bool[]).notice: Update bridge receiver adapters. This function can only be called by executeMessage() invoked within receiveMessage() of this contract, which means the only party who can make these updates is the caller of the MultiMessageSender at the source chain.

documentation.text: @notice A modifier used for restricting the caller of some functions to be configured receiver adapters.
@notice A modifier used for restricting the caller of some functions to be this contract itself.
@notice A one-time function to initialize contract states.

documentation.text:
@notice Receive messages from allowed bridge receiver adapters.
 If the accumulated power of a message has reached the power threshold,
 this message will be executed immediately, which will invoke an external function call
 according to the message content.
